intro: Sarothamnus andreanus, commonly known as the Greek thyme, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its aromatic properties make it useful in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. Sarothamnus andreanus is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
